Description: Statement adopted by the Continental Congress declaring independence from the British Empire.
The first ten amendments of the U.S. Constitution guaranteeing rights and freedoms.
A document written during the Seneca Falls Convention outlining the rights that American women should be entitled to as citizens.
An executive order granting freedom to slaves in designated southern states.
A speech delivered by President Abraham Lincoln during the American Civil War, at the dedication of the Soldiers' National Cemetery in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.
A collection of 85 articles and essays written by Alexander Hamilton, James Madison, and John Jay promoting the ratification of the United States Constitution.
A charter of rights agreed to by King John of England at Runnymede, near Windsor, on 15 June 1215.

Document title: United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights
Description: A milestone document in the history of human rights, proclaimed by the United Nations General Assembly in Paris on 10 December 1948.
